column4: hey all, is it possible to seperate a network into two parts which cannot see each other but can see the internet, all coming in on one interface (eth0)
I have been trying to use aliasing and a dhcp to put people in the correct subnet but sofar I have been un successfull as my computer has been able to ping both 192.168.2.1 and 1.1
and which subnet is your computer part of?
was part of? how about now?
it still is I have reverted my changed that I was making and searching for help in the matter
what separates 1.x from 2.x ? and is the subnet mask 255.255.255.0 for both?
the subnet is 255.255.255.0 for both yes - I was hoping both subnets couldn't see each other
well, what separates (or joins) the two subnets ??  a router
yeh a router joins the two networks (sorry I didn't understand the first time)
ok, it's probable that the router allows cross-subnet communication - i can't think of anything else that would allow you to pind 2.x from 1.1
perhaps you should be looking to configure the router to stop people from pinging across subnets
ok well its loaded with linux I tried adding a iptables rule to stop 192.168.1.0/24 communicating with 192.168.2.0/24 and vice versa but it didn't seem to work
I am a bit inexperianced with networking and linux but I am sure I can make it work somehow
sure - just takes a little patience and some research .. but this should stop ip forwarding. on the router itself.  echo 0 | sudo tee /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward
that command stopped me from pinging from my computer out to the wan untill I reverted it
so what would you recomend as reading material for serperating networks on the same interface? my google powers havn't turned up much...
